Summary Plenty of experience in Cloud Computing while working on different projects built on AWS technologies (like S3, EC2, Elastic Map Reduce, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS, etc) and on Microsoft Azure (Virtual Machines, HDInsight, Blob Store, Table Store, EventHub, etc) stack. 
 
Good amount of work done in Platform development in different areas – few examples like data processing workflow system on AWS; for software deployment on hundreds of machines in a datacenter; for data ingestion system with configurable sources and sinks in Azure. 
 
Good hands-on experience on Big Data Analytics and Aggregation on several TBs of data, using Hadoop technologies like Hive, MapReduce, Oozie and Java and make them work on static Hadoop cluster, on AWS Elastic MapReduce cluster, and on Azure HDInsight. 
 
Extensive experience in Web Application Development using LAMP. Has experience in designing large-scale applications with High Availability, Failover and Caching mechanism. 
 
Good DevOps experience in Software Deployment for entire stack using Puppet/Shell Scripting – ranging from Hadoop cluster setup, setting up of variety of frontend and backend applications and also setting up Virtual Machines on local desktops. 
 
￼Good experience in Feed Data Processing and General Application Development with data size ranging from applications needing to run on single machines to very large feeds processing on distributed environment, using Hadoop MapReduce. 
 
Worked on Information Extraction systems and also on some of the Machine Learning techniques in the past. 
 
Flexible to work in different programming languages, different technologies and frameworks and have the desire and ability to learn and adapt new technologies as and when needed. 
 
Good in Reverse Engineering existing systems and gaining knowledge from others. 
 
Strong problem solving and analytical skills with good knowledge of Data structures and Algorithms. Principal Technical Architect Collaborative Consulting February 2006  –  April 2010  (4 years 3 months) Technical architect for 5 high profile projects for Collaborative Consulting. All projects exceeded client expectations and in each case resulted in additional work being purchased. Acted as the principal developer on each project, often leading a small team as well.  
 
In house projects included the development of JTrace. Conceived and developed to reverse engineer any Java based application using AspectJ. Only one command line option was needed to instrument the JVM. Business transactions are mapped transparently as a request travels through one or more application tiers. A button click from the UI resulted in reports generated that showed all execution paths across all tiers. JTrace reconstructed the execution flow back into hierarchal XML structure used for reporting. In addition any JDBC, JMS, JTA, Servlet, EJB, Socket, Thread, etc… was also collected in context. Custom reports based on the clients needs are created from the data collected. This was successfully applied to RxConnect resulting in a holistic view of the RxConnect application. Key architectural improvements were easily identified. Principal Technical Architect Retail Convergence for Collaborative Consulting January 2010  –  March 2010  (3 months) Architected and single-handedly wrote a custom UI used to monitor the ESB that integrates Retail Convergence and GSI. From the UI, administrators can change workflow steps, generate custom reports, monitor requests and trigger complex reposts back into the ESB. Dashboards provide real time insight into the performance of the system. The front end is written in GWT. Server-side business logic is written in Groovy using a custom high level DSL. Backend systems are monitored using JMX. Alerts to third party systems are triggered using a complex event processing framework called Esper. Performance Architect CVS Corporation – RxConnect for Collaborative Consulting January 2008  –  December 2009  (2 years) CVS is replacing their core pharmacy system. The new pharmacy system is a custom 3 million line Java application, consisting of over 500 Weblogic instances and a 28 terabyte database. The system will handle 68 billion dollars worth of drug fills a year across 7,000 stores nationwide. The application runs each store as well as all the calculations at central. My role was to redesign core pieces to improve scalability and time to market. Changes included a twenty fold increase in performance of the number of prescription fills per second, security model, caching, queue refresh, central sync, heartbeat and reconciliation processes. Each change often touched major pieces of a very complex application. Backward compatibility is paramount because stores are upgraded at different times. Wrote implementations demonstrating the increased scalability and performance. Diagnosed major issues impeding the progress of performance testing. Identified bugs in both IBM’s JVM and Oracle’s JDBC drivers. My work in this role resulted in the expansion of the team from 4 consultants to 30 within one year. Technical Architect Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA – Behavioral Heath Outcomes for Collaborative Consulting April 2007  –  November 2007  (8 months) Architected enterprise wide SOA security model for partners accessing web services from external partners. Designed the model, presented it for approval to the clients architecture team, which included creation of use cases and technical design documents (using established OOA/OOD principals); design of a new directory structure for LDAP; Sun’s Access Manager configuration and roles definition; and custom web service security policies for handling message level signing and encryption using an ESB. Technical Architect Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA – Member Portal for Collaborative Consulting May 2006  –  November 2007  (1 year 7 months) Led a small team of developers in the definition of the company’s SOA architecture and the construction of 65 custom and reusable web services. The services provided the backbone for the next iteration of bluecrossma.com self service application. The services covered fourteen functional areas including viewing Claims, Benefits, Deductibles, Referrals, and User Management. Users were also capable of retrieving new ID cards, updating their address and PCP information. An ESB was extended to support a custom security model. Services communicated to the mainframe systems through SeeBeyond messaging. An existing registration schema was extended to support registering members to LDAP and Oracle. Four custom SSO’s to external partners were developed using both preparatory schemes as well as SAML. Maven was introduced to automate the build process. Technical Lead Iron Mountain – Automated Data Restoration for Collaborative Consulting March 2006  –  June 2006  (4 months) Technical lead on a project to automate a manual data restoration process. The process restored assets from tapes and made them available online. The SOA style of architecture leveraged TIBCO as a workflow engine to coordinate the activities across multiple types of systems and servers distributed across two separate datacenters. Messaging was used to communicate with the servers. A console application was built to administer the system. Both Oracle and SQL Server database instances were updated and reported on. Technical Lead Monitor August 2004  –  January 2006  (1 year 6 months) As the technical lead for 5 major projects, guided 3 to 7 colleagues from inception through deployment. Responsibilities included producing architectural diagrams, designing project plans and implementing designs.  
 
Galapagos  
•	Using a custom designed, genetic algorithm engine, architected a complex financial trading system which evolves computer programs to predict future market trends. 
•	Programs are randomly generated by the computer program and traded within a virtual stock market for a given time period. At the end of each generation, the best programs breed with other programs (using the laws of genetics) to produce stronger offspring. After many generations the strongest programs trade on the real stock market making atomic financial decisions.  
•	Wrote over 700 classes and 60,000 lines of custom code in C# and .NET Forms. 
•	Product is being used by 2 hedge fund companies and the Monitor Group.  
 
Virtual Coach  
•	Upgraded the existing Virtual Coach web-based application to enhance marketability by redesigning the user interface and page flow.  
•	Added a complex permission system based on groups and roles to allow the sharing of custom content. 
•	Added a task management and reminder system for goal tracking. 
 
Infrastructure Upgrade  
•	Ported over 100 objects from custom O/R solution to Hibernate. Re-implemented workflow, permission, and editing frameworks to work with multiple O/R solutions.  
•	Evaluated code to enhance portability between application servers, improve performance and enhance flexibility of new applications.
